Roti.question: You own a popular boutique in a local market & your designs are loved in your neighbourhood. You know you are good with fashion & design. You can start your own label and sell your own branded outfits.

options.text: Never, I am happy with my current business.
Sometimes, I am uncertain to make such a big decision.
Always, I would start my own label one day.

Roti.question: You want to start your snack & beverage cafeteria in a university campus to attract students, what is your first choice of place to set up the cafeteria?

options.text: Rent out a property on the main campus, though it costs more, it would be profitable. Thus, I would spend my savings, and borrow from a financial institution, family & friends.
Rent out a property in the corner because it is affordable, look for main road shops only when profits come
Start the business on vending truck, and wait for the time when there are enough funds to rent/buy a full shop

Roti.question: Your  distant  relative  left  you Rs.500,000 in  her  will.  How  do  you  plan  to utilize  it for  your business?

options.text: Buy a new scooter/other utility for operations at work.
Use for shop renovation and improvement to grow business
Deposit all the money in savings account and use them on a rainy-day

Roti.question: You run a furniture shop and are facing competition because of online stores. You feel uncertain about the future of your business. What will you do?

options.text: I will close my business and look for a job under a big carpenter/contractor or a furniture brand
I will put my furniture on e-commerce stores and compete on the quality of my products
I will put my furniture on e-commerce stores and compete on the quality of my products
I will market my product with a new positioning - handmade, artistic and unique. Give offers to  my loyal customers and create my google business profile.

Roti.question: Growing up you thought you take up a govt. job, but as you grew, you realized, you               wanted to be your own master. What does it take to start a micro-business?

options.text: Funds/Financial Backing
Passion/Creativity/Ideas
Necessity/Strong will
Business acumen/ Skills

Kapda.question: Wonder if you know what is insurance, credit, payments?

options.text: I know credit, insurance & payments.
I know credit & insurance but not payments
I know credit, not insurance or payments

Kapda.question: You  have  made  financial  decisions  on  investment,  insurance,  etc.  for  yourself,  they  will  be based on:

options.text: Entirely driven by choice
Entirely driven by recommendations from friends, internet, etc.
Based on family suggestions and my own research
I do not make investments & insurance decisions by myself, they are decided by family

Kapda.question: Your neighbour lost a lot of money in the share market, what would you advise him?

options.text: Not to invest in share market, it is not for us. My neighbour was a fool to get involved
Not to invest in share market unless you have researched about it well enough
Shares can be risky, but they can give high returns. Not to worry and seek advice from expert
Not to invest in share markets, utilize that money in your business for business returns

Kapda.question: You earned Rs. 10,000 surplus profits during the festival season. Whether you should spend the money on your   store or buy in a comprehensive family insurance plan that your brother-in-law is pitching?

options.text: I’ll purchase insurance recommended by brother – law this time, also,happy brother-in-law, happy wife, happy life!
I’ll colour my Pooja store red, buy Feng shui for all the good luck, no need of any insurance scheme
I’ll do a simple FD, best to save money when you have it

Kapda.question: Your health insurance claim did not come yet, you are upset that insurance never work when you need them. How would you tackle this situation?

options.text: I will consider it as my fate and pledge not to take any further insurance policies from anyone
I will contact the insurer and seek help, if no help arrives, I’ll reach the regulators
I will file police complain against the insurer and report on social media

Makaan.question: You have Rs.1000 per month to invest, but, your financial decisions are generally taken by your                     husband/son/ family advisor because they are suppose to be more aware than you are.

options.text: Disagree, I manage my own business and make my own decisions
Neutral, I might give it to them to invest, or can invest myself
Strongly agree, my family can invest and knows best where to invest

Makaan.question: You balance your spending with savings for the future

options.text: Neutral, I will save & spend according to personal & household needs
Somewhat Disagree, I am an intuitive spender
Agree, I will save in a bank to earn interests & feel secure

Makaan.question: You hail from Firozabad, the city famous for glass work. Lately, you are facing competition due to trendy bangle designs in metal & plastic. How do you plan to address the competition?

options.text: I will transition to new business in the glass industry
I will learn and get training to digitize my business to open my own e- store to compete
I will upgrade to premium quality and focus on international market with some expert help

Makaan.question: This year, your farms harvested tonnes of mangoes for you to sell, though the market is already full of mangoes. What would you do?

options.text: I will sell at whatever price is available in the market
I would put my mangoes in cold storage and wait for over supply to finish
I would set up a jam’s factory and work with SHG group to get into jam making

Makaan.question: You are a conservative person, thus always looking for low risk returns. Which of the following options will give you  assured returns?

options.text: Savings account and/or money in my ‘galla’
SIP, mutual funds, ULIP Insurance Schemes pitched by my friends
Investing in my business

Internet.question: Your favourite thing to watch on YouTube today?

options.text: New recipes to cook and/or new designs to make
My favourite serial, movies, music video
I do not watch YouTube often, my husband/son has the smart

Internet.question: You are scared of smartphone-based payments.

options.text: Disagree, I am always using the app on the phone
Neutral, I can use them sometimes
Strongly agree, my kids know all about these apps

Internet.question: Do you prefer to receive money via UPI/QR Code at your store?

options.text: Yes, it is the need these days, I accept digital payments often
No, I generally prefer cash
Yes, but not so often, I am a little cautious in using digital modes

Internet.question: Your husband recommends you use a popular book keeping app to maintain your accounts, what is your response?

options.text: I am comfortable my register and pen, and it is serving me well
OK, teach me how to use the app, I will give it a try if it is easy to use
I am already using many application and I prefer the one I use currently
I don’t need to do book keeping, our shop is a small and I keep a mental record ;)

Internet.question: You neighbouring shopkeeper pays his EMIs through his bank account, but you have to visit bank for the same. To change this, what will you do?

options.text: I’ll ask my banker to deduct from my bank account directly
I will understand the whole process and then fill the form at the bank for remote  EMI deduction
Nothing, I prefer security over ease. I will do cash payments
